author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

guild.description:
Here we go again...

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/post/66iv/ee_ubwXLfNg)

*Cabal*: n. the contrived schemes of a group of persons secretly united in a plot - also: a group engaged in such schemes.

*Powermod*: n. [short for power moderator] a person of power, usually a moderator on a structured website, that takes too many unpopulist stances

This guild is dedicated to whistleblowing and preventing powermods and the forming of a powermod oligarchy which would censor opinions and lead Ruqqus into the same corruption that is killing Reddit.
guild.description_html:
Here we go again...

Cabal: n. the contrived schemes of a group of persons secretly united in a plot - also: a group engaged in such schemes.

Powermod: n. [short for power moderator] a person of power, usually a moderator on a structured website, that takes too many unpopulist stances

This guild is dedicated to whistleblowing and preventing powermods and the forming of a powermod oligarchy which would censor opinions and lead Ruqqus into the same corruption that is killing Reddit.
guild.name: The_Cabal

meta_description:
This is an upcoming feature that will introduce a new feed in the sidebar (along all, trending, etc) called "Featured".

Featured will be comprised of fun, engaging, and interesting posts found across ruqqus; it will be manually curated by the admins with requests from the community.

I'm thinking a sticky post in +ruqqus could suffice for featured post recommendations. Basically, each day we'd select roughly 25 new posts to be featured and for the next 24 hrs they'd have a porpl pin icon. Afterwards, the icon would change to sparkles with a tooltip indicating which day it was featured on.

The idea is to promote original and quality content from the community, which otherwise could go unnoticed due to the poor discoverability algorithms and the small scale that ruqqus is.

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/pull/742
meta_title: [feature] A new feed called "featured" PR 742 - Ruqqus
title: And this is when they start picking who and what gets visibility

body:
On the one hand, I'll agree that the retarded Reddit consoomer demographic is far more likely to buy Ruqqus "gold" than the average Ruqqer.

On the other, what makes you think they will be able to leave the Reddit app, let alone switch from Reddit's endless stream of porn and botposts to your 20 fake curated pornless botposts?

Realistically, if you keep banning the top posters that keep people coming back, soon you won't have a user-generated-content problem anymore.
body_html:
On the one hand, I'll agree that the retarded Reddit consoomer demographic is far more likely to buy Ruqqus "gold" than the average Ruqqer.

On the other, what makes you think they will be able to leave the Reddit app, let alone switch from Reddit's endless stream of porn and botposts to your 20 fake curated pornless botposts?

Realistically, if you keep banning the top posters that keep people coming back, soon you won't have a user-generated-content problem anymore.

body: It's obvious why they're actually doing it. They're going to unfairly promote specific users and guilds that they like. This is reminiscent of reddit choosing default subreddits for the first time. The next thing they did after that was choose the default cabal moderators. Except here it's more flexible to their wishes and includes users too, and overall they will promote whatever content they like too.
body_html: It's obvious why they're actually doing it. They're going to unfairly promote specific users and guilds that they like. This is reminiscent of reddit choosing default subreddits for the first time. The next thing they did after that was choose the default cabal moderators. Except here it's more flexible to their wishes and includes users too, and overall they will promote whatever content they like too.

body: You saw what happens on reddit with their discovery features. They exclusively promote powermods and their subreddits. I hate to break it to you but there's no reason to think ruqqus would do any differently, as they've already shown almost as much sketchiness as reddit aside from a half-hearted commitment to free speech. Even if they were trustworthy there would still be bias, which is the problem with any system of subjectivity. Everyone says "it's no big deal" but we'll see where we end up after it all adds up over time.
body_html: You saw what happens on reddit with their discovery features. They exclusively promote powermods and their subreddits. I hate to break it to you but there's no reason to think ruqqus would do any differently, as they've already shown almost as much sketchiness as reddit aside from a half-hearted commitment to free speech. Even if they were trustworthy there would still be bias, which is the problem with any system of subjectivity. Everyone says "it's no big deal" but we'll see where we end up after it all adds up over time.
